articles.description: All the latest football with Liverpool, Newcastle and Arsenal news conferences and build-up to the midweek games.

articles.description: Arsenal will not stop fighting for the Premier League title despite slipping 11 points behind leaders Liverpool, says Gunners boss Mikel Arteta.
articles.title: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says club won't give up on Premier League title race

articles.description: Double South Africa World Cup-winning prop Steven Kitshoff is forced to retire because of a serious neck injury.
articles.title: Steven Kitshoff: South Africa double World Cup winner retires with neck injury

articles.description: Galatasaray said they would "initiate criminal proceedings" against Fenerbahce manager Jose Mourinho after claiming he made "racist statements" following the teams' 0-0 draw on Monday.
articles.title: Jose Mourinho: Galatasaray accuse Portuguese of making 'racist statements'

articles.description: The battle to earn selection for the British and Irish Lions squad continued in the third round of the Six Nations, but who staked their claim?
articles.title: Lions watch: Finn Russell to start at fly-half? Maro Itoje for captain?

articles.description: Pakistan’s heavy loss to India on Sunday rekindles the debate - has this rivalry become overhyped?
articles.title: Is India v Pakistan still cricket's greatest rivalry?

articles.description: Max Verstappen says Red Bull are "confident" they have made the right changes to their car as he seeks a fifth consecutive drivers' title.
articles.title: Max Verstappen says Red Bull 'confident' of gains with new car

articles.description: Afghanistan's players know "full well" things are "not correct" in their home country, says coach Jonathan Trott amid criticism of women's rights under the Taliban.
articles.title: Champions Trophy 2025 England v Afghanistan: Coach Jonathan Trott on bravery of his players

articles.description: England's Ben Stokes is set to miss The Hundred to focus on his fitness after not being retained by Northern Superchargers for the 2025 tournament.
articles.title: The Hundred: Ben Stokes set to miss 2025 competition to focus on Ashes fitness
